PokerProject

Class Debug

  • Object
    • Game
      • Debug
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    VideoPoker

    public class Debug
extends Game
    Class Debug extends Class Game and it represents the Debug Mode of playing Video Poker.

    When running in this mode, the game is fully loaded from two files:

    • cmd-file - file with the commands for playing the game;
    • card-file - file with the cards (already ordered) for the game.

    This class has three more attributes besides the ones from its superclass:

    • cardInput - array of Character that contains the content of the commands' file;
    • cmdFileName - variable of type String which represents the name of the file with the commands for playing the game.
    • cardsFileName - variable of type String which represents the name of the file with the cards (already ordered) for the game.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Debug

        public Debug(int initMoney,
             String cmdNameStr,
             String cardNameStr,
             Variants optionTable)
        Constructor specifying the initial balance of the player, the name of two files and the Variants of Video Poker being used. Some of these attributes are the same used to construct the superclass Game.
        Parameters:
        initMoney - initial balance of the player when starting the game.
        cmdNameStr - name of the file with the commands for playing the game.
        cardNameStr - name of the file with the cards (already ordered) for the game.
        optionTable - variant of Video Poker used in the game.

    • Method Detail

      • play

        public void play()
          throws IOException
        Play the game in Debug Mode. Reads the commands from a file, saves them in cardInput, reads the cards to use in the game from a file, saves them in the deck and then acts accordingly until there are no more commands to read. Options available:
        • $ - ask for the player's credit;
        • s - ask for the statistics of the game since the beginning;
        • b - ask for betting a value;
        • d - ask for dealing cards;
        • h - ask for holding cards;
        • a - ask for advice about what cards to hold.

        Note that an error message is printed in case of illegal command input.

        Specified by:
        play in interface VideoPoker
        Specified by:
        play in class Game
        Throws:
        IOException - If an error occurs while reading inputs from file.

      • doDeal

        public void doDeal()
        When asked for dealing the cards (in Debug Mode) a message with the first hand is printed in the terminal. It is possible to ask for the deal only if there was a betValue previously done (in other moves) and before choosing which cards to hold. Five cards from the deck are assigned as the user's first hand and the bet value is decremented from the player's credit. Note that an error message is printed in case of illegal command input.
